text: Information below is designed to use
Verify the delivery of the drive
is compatible with the supply range of the drive.
HAZARD OF ELECTRIC SHOCK, EXPLOSION OR ARC FLASH
Before performing work on the drive system:
Lock all power switches in the open position.
Before applying voltage to the drive system:
Verify proper grounding of all equipment.
verify that it has not been damaged.
Do not use damaged products or accessories.
for other mounting and thermal conditions.
Connect the drive to the ground.
Connect the drive to the motor.
Connect the drive to the supply mains.
HAZARD OF FIRE OR ELECTRIC SHOCK
clearance may help to connect the ground.
Connect The Drive: Control by External Reference
At first power up, the drive displays
Set motor parameters for asynchronous motor
Nominal motor power on motor nameplate (KW)
Nominal motor voltage on motor nameplate (V)
Nominal motor current on motor nameplate (A)
Nominal motor frequency on motor nameplate (Hz)
Nominal motor speed on motor nameplate (rpm)
Refer to the ATV320 Programming manual
